question: 形容詞
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>part of speech</kanji> that creates the <kanji>shape</kanji> and <kanji>form</kanji> of a word is something that is descriptive (its shape and form are in there, after all!). This shape and form part of speech is an <vocabulary>adjective</vocabulary>. You are so beautiful!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
